member.name: T:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag
member.summary: The database operation to perform.

member.name: F:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag.None
member.summary: No operation.

member.name: F:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag.Insert
member.summary: Insert rows into a set of database tables.

member.name: F:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag.InsertIdentity
member.summary: Insert rows into a set of database tables. Allow identity inserts to occur.

member.name: F:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag.Delete
member.summary: Delete rows from a set of database tables.

member.name: F:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag.DeleteAll
member.summary: Delete all rows from a set of database tables.

member.name: F:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag.Update
member.summary: Update rows in a set of database tables.

member.name: F:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag.Refresh
member.summary: Refresh rows in a set of database tables. Rows that exist in the database are updated. Rows that don't exist are inserted.

member.name: F:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag.CleanInsert
member.summary: Composite operation of DeleteAll and Insert.

member.name: F:NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag.CleanInsertIdentity
member.summary: Composite operation of DeleteAll and InsertIdentity.

member.name: T:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator
member.summary: Class that builds an iterator for tables. The order of the tables returned by the iterator is determined by the foreign keys between tables.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.#ctor(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Constructor that takes in a dataset to build iterator for the tables.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.BuildTableList(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Builds the table list.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.ReverseListIfNeeded
member.summary: Reverses the list if needed.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.#ctor(System.Data.DataSet,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: if set to true [iterate in reverse].

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.AddTablesToList(System.Data.DataTableCollection)
member.summary: Iterate over tables in dataset and at them to the internal list.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.ShouldAddToList(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Adds a table to the list if - It hasn't already been added - It has no relations to parent tables where the parent table isn't in the list.
member.param: DataTable to check if it meets conditions to add to list.
member.returns: True if should add, otherwise false.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.System#Collections#Generic#IEnumerable{System#Data#DataTable}#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.
member.returns: true if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; false if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.
member.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.Reset
member.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the collection.
member.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

member.name: P:NDbUnit.Core.DataSetTableIterator.System#Collections#IEnumerator#Current
member.summary: Gets the current element in the collection.
member.returns: The current element in the collection.
member.exception: The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.

member.name: T:NDbUnit.Core.NDbUnitTest
member.summary: The base class implementation of all NDbUnit unit test data adapters.

member.name: T:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest
member.summary: Represents a unit test database initialization operation.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.PerformDbOperation(NDbUnit.Core.DbOperationFlag)
member.summary: Performs a database operation.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.ReadXmlSchema(System.String)
member.summary: Read in an xml schema file whose schema represents a set of tables in a database. This schema file is used to build the database modification commands that are used to update the database. This is the first function that must be called prior to any other functions being called on the interface. Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.
member.remarks: The xml schema file can be generated by dragging and dropping tables from Visual Studio's server explorer into a DataSet.xsd file.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.ReadXmlSchema(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read in an xml schema whose schema represents a set of tables in a database. This schema is used to build the database modification commands that are used to update the database. This is the first function that must be called prior to any other functions being called on the interface. Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.ReadXml(System.String)
member.summary: Read in an xml file whose data should be conform to the schema of the file specified in the call to . If the data does not conform to the schema, it will be ignored. This data is used to update the database.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.ReadXml(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read in an xml stream whose data should be conform to the schema specified in the call to . If the data does not conform to the schema, it will be ignored. This data is used to update the database.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.AppendXml(System.String)
member.summary: Read in an xml file whose data should be conform to the schema of the file specified in the call to . The data is appended to any existing data in the dataset. If the data does not conform to the schema, it will be ignored. This data is used to update the database.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.AppendXml(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read in an xml stream whose data should be conform to the schema specified in the call to . The data is appended to any existing data in the dataset. If the data does not conform to the schema, it will be ignored. This data is used to update the database.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.CopyDataSet
member.summary: Gets a object that contains both the internal schema information and data.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.CopySchema
member.summary: Gets a object that contains only the internal schema information.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.GetDataSetFromDb
member.summary: Gets a data set from the database tables. Includes all table names in the xml schema.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.GetDataSetFromDb(System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection)
member.summary: Gets a data set from the database tables.
member.param: The list of table names in the xml schema to export. If null, then all table names in the xml schema will be exported.

member.name: E:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.PostOperation
member.summary: Occurs after DbOperation has completed.

member.name: E:NDbUnit.Core.INDbUnitTest.PreOperation
member.summary: Occurs before DbOperation begins.

member.name: T:NDbUnit.Core.NDbUnitException
member.summary: The base class exception of all exceptions thrown by objects in NDbUnit.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.NDbUnitException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.NDbUnitException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.NDbUnitException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

member.name: M:NDbUnit.Core.NDbUnitException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
